phasepy.component¶

Phasepy phasepy.component function creates an object that stores necessary pure component information needed for equilibria and interfacial properties computation. The following parameters are allowed.

  • name : name of the component
  • Tc : Critical temperature in Kelvin
  • Pc : Critical pressure in bar
  • Zc : critical compresibility factor
  • Vc : Critical volume in cm \(^3\)/mol
  • w : Acentric Factor
  • c : Volume translation parameter used in cubic EoS in cm \(^3\)/mol
  • cii : polynomial coefficient for influence parameter in SGT, final units must be in J mol/m \(^5\).
  • ksv : parameters to evaluate alpha functionof PRSV EoS
  • Ant : Antoine correlation parameters
  • GC : Group contribution information used in Modified-UNIFAC activity coefficient model, a list of possible groups can be found in here.

A component can be created as follows:

>>> from phasepy import component
>>> water = component(name = 'water', Tc = 647.13, Pc = 220.55, Zc = 0.229, Vc = 55.948, w = 0.344861,
...        Ant =  [  11.64785144, 3797.41566067,  -46.77830444],
...        GC = {'H2O':1})

Besides storing pure component data, the created object incorporates basics methods for saturation pressure evaluation and liquid volume with Rackett equation.

>>> water.psat(T = 373)
1.0072796747419537
>>> water.vlrackett(T = 310)
16.46025809309672

Warning

Remember to supply the necessary parameters for the model that you are going to use

class component(name='None', Tc=0, Pc=0, Zc=0, Vc=0, w=0, c=0, cii=0, ksv=[0, 0], Ant=[0, 0, 0], GC=None, ms=1, sigma=0, eps=0, lambda_r=12.0, lambda_a=6.0, eAB=0.0, rcAB=1.0, rdAB=0.4, sites=[0, 0, 0])[source]¶

Creates an object with pure component info

Parameters:
  • name (str) – Name of the component
  • Tc (float) – Critical temperature
  • Pc (float) – Critical Pressure
  • Zc (float) – critical compresibility factor
  • Vc (float) – critical volume
  • w (float) – acentric factor
  • cii (list) – polynomial coefficient for influence parameter in SGT
  • ksv (list) – parameter for alpha for PRSV EoS, if fitted
  • Ant (list) – Antoine correlation parameters
  • GC (dict) – Group contribution info
name¶

Name of the component

Type:str
Tc¶

Critical temperature

Type:float
Pc¶

Critical Pressure

Type:float
Zc¶

critical compresibility factor

Type:float
Vc¶

critical volume

Type:float
w¶

acentric factor

Type:float
c¶

volume translation parameter used if cubic EoS

Type:float
cii¶

polynomial coefficient for influence parameter in SGT

Type:list
ksv¶

parameter for alpha for PRSV EoS, if fitted

Type:list
Ant¶

Antoine correlation parameters

Type:list
GC¶

Group contribution info

Type:dict
psat : computes saturation pressure with Antoine correlation
tsat : compues saturation temperature with Antoine correlation
vlrackett : computes liquid volume with Rackett correlation
ci : evaluates influence parameter polynomial
ci(T)[source]¶

Method that evaluates the polynomial for cii coeffient of SGT cii must be in J m^5 / mol and T in K.

Parameters:T (float) – absolute temperature in K
Returns:ci – influence parameter at given temperature
Return type:float
psat(T)[source]¶

Method that computes saturation pressure at T using Ant eq. Expontential base is used.

Parameters:T (float) – absolute temperature in K
Returns:Psat – Saturation pressure in bar
Return type:foat
tsat(P)[source]¶

Method that computes the saturation temperature at P using Ant eq. Expontential base is used.

Parameters:Psat (foat) – Saturation pressure in bar
Returns:T – absolute temperature in K
Return type:float
vlrackett(T)[source]¶

Method that computes the liquid volume using Rackett eq.

Parameters:T (float) – absolute temperature in K
Returns:vl – liquid volume in cm3/mol
Return type:float
